title: RIOT, can we talk about Sona's AWFUL gameplay
body:
Seriously, sona might be the most poorly designed champion not only in LoL, but in any moba. She leaves no skill expression since all 3 of her basic abilities are aoe and can't be aimed at all, and her ultimate is pretty much impossible to miss honestly. She also has no counterplay really, unless you consider "burst her down very very very fast" counterplay. (which, tip, it's not. making someone's average lifespan .25s is very NOT fun actually)

While her stats in Summoners Rift games might be meh, her stats in ARAM and pretty much every RGM she's allowed in are the best! She was so crazy in URF she had to be outright banned. Her winright in ARAM is the highest of all champs at almost 70%! 70%!
In Ascension and Poro King she boasts similarly amazing stats, always placing in the top 5. 

Is there any talk of a rework? A re balancing? ANYTHING? Sona is honestly such a poorly designed, poorly executed champion that I have no idea why she even exists. 

(That said, I LOVELOVELOVE playing Sona, mostly because since I do mostly ARAM and RGM now, it feels like a totally free win that I don't even have to try for. But I still see that it's ABSURDLY unhealthy gameplay design.

replies.body:
IMO, she does take plenty of skill to play, it is just macro skill that you need and not so much micro skill. You have to position properly to distribute your buffs to as many people as possible without being close enough to the enemy team to get blown up, and only going for the safest of pokes. You have to make sure you use the right passive auto for the moment, Q for poke, W for trades, E for peel. Your ult isn't that hard to hit, but getting the most bang for your buck out of it can be somewhat difficult when you factor in that you need to position yourself so that you can hit as many of your teammates as possible with your aura so you don't have as much freedom to move to hit multiple lined up opponents.

Pressing your skill keys don't require much skill, but using them to their fullest does. I am not saying she is the hardest champ ever, but she does have a decent macro level skill ceiling. She is one of my favorite champion skill designs because she lets people with a skillset that is not geared towards micro play shine.

It all seems to revolve around the passive auto, which honestly you guys are WAY overrating. There's a reason she is so highly played at low ELO but VERY scarce at high ELO. she's a noob magnet and her passive autos dont change that

Nope, I played Ahri a lot before her reworks and she was the defining champ that can actually show SOOO much potential after you use your effort to learn her. 

Ahri is both easy and hard. She is easy to understand, but how you use her is a different story. The ability to stop dashes with charm, ability to kite with rylais, and the ability to reposition using ultimate. All of this required intense mechanics that required putting some time to accomplish. 

You may say that you have already done this without effort, then this goes to show that some people may click better than others. Ahri now is the shadow of herself. 

Ahri seems simple but very complex. It is weird but I hope you get it!

The only thing that was removed was the ability to stop dashes with charm. She still players really similar to how she used to. Yeah, maybe kiting is easier with the speed boost, but it's not like her ultimate has changed.

Her range was cut by 100 on w and r. That made her build combined with rylais very very weak. She actually has worse kiting now than before. Her kiting did become easier for those who could not kite before.

Range is a huge outplay mechanic that can exist. ADC having just 25 more range can make a huge difference. Ahri losing 100 range on her w and r did make her lose a huge portion of her outplay potential because the range she needs to be in now puts her into range for all the free damage of many champ that just bursts her without any outplay potential. 

Her passive was also changed from spell vamp to per enemy hit. This is a huge nerf to her skill cap as she had the ability to actually recover a good amount when bursting with her passive up. This further made her into a really really weak and squishy and short ranged champ.

Her skill expression lies in using your different empowered auto attacks and not spamming so much as to run oom. Plus hitting that ult

The empowered autos are a cool idea, but honestly come down to "can you count to 3?". It's like saying Annie's passive is skill intensive. Nah man, you just need to be able to count on your fingers.

sona is just straight up op

https://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=LightMoon
They already reworked her in the previous season. Not a full rework, but the smaller kind. People need to realize they need to leave lower skill cap champs for some people.

Sona's basic gameplay is a refreshing breath of air in the extremely over-complicated modern champion "designs" (or lack thereof). Her skill expression lies in good positioning, mana management (I guess you could buy Tear to solve it, but Tear is also an awful item rn), hitting your ult (Lot more difficult than you think! It's very easy to Flash over it and punch Sona in the tits), and just moving around the map properly.

Her kit is very well-designed (not including the wholly unnecessary CDR her ult passively gives as part of the failed rework). She's pretty good on the Rift as it is, but she's only great in RGM/ARAM because the map is as cramped as it can be. There's no way to miss ult on that map without aiming 180 degrees in the wrong direction. RGM/ARAM stats are worth less than nothing.

If you only "LOVELOVELOVE playing Sona" for her ability to cheese ARAMs, then shame on you. Shame. On. You. There's many different reasons to play her: Great secondary mage, excellent healer (Windspeaker's + Ardent rush and your ADC will never die unless they're stupid), highly engaging gameplay (Yes, you do more than just mash buttons), making your Rammus even faster, ridiculous burst damage with Lich Bane (Blue Chord + Q + Lich Auto = de_leted), and more. She's a pretty general support, but she's good at her job.

(Btw Sona is one of my highest mastery champions, I believe 2nd or 3rd place behind Vayne and MAYBE Ezreal or Ashe. I just haven't played her recently since I've been on a Sejuani and Rakan kick. Branching out a bit into engage champions.)
I get Tear and Sheen early on Sona, it solves her mana problems almost completely, and even gives her more damage and CDR. After that it's straight on to the Forbidden Idol items.

> She leaves no skill expression since all 3 of her basic abilities are aoe and can't be aimed at all

Wrong.  She aims them by positioning.  When you're the squishiest champion in the game, with the lowest gold and exp on the map, AND most of that gold is going into items that give zero defensive stats, positioning is a matter of life and death.  And her toolkit to manage it with is... one move speed steroid.

> making someone's average lifespan .25s is very NOT fun actually

It's not fun for that person, but it IS counterplay, and damned effective counterplay at that.  Maybe too effective for her viability in higher elo, but without the giant KILL ME FIRST signs she'd low elo stomp even more than Master Yi.

The thing that makes Sona hard to balance is how bad a lot of people are at playing AGAINST her.  "Oh I'll just take this 1v1 trade and ignore Sona over there... WTF I lost the trade!?"  Repeat until insane winrate (on a champion that is objectively underpowered against people who know what they're doing).  People don't try that against Leona more than once or twice because it's *obvious* why spending half of the trade stunned makes you lose it, and therefore, you need to take Leona's presence seriously.

>Seriously, sona might be the most poorly designed champion not only in LoL, but in any moba. 

I think this is unfair over-exaggeration.

Sona was designed to be an Aura-Champion. A champion that can buff your entire team rather than the standard enchanter which can only buff 1/2 allies at a time.
She is the easiest champion (no doubt), but she still requires a suitable amount of skill to be used effectively.

Suitable counter-play is to use Vanguards and pin her or her ADC down. She only has 1 hard cc (which is only available at level 6). She will struggle against the likes of {{champion:53}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:412}} etc.

Why are we complaining about a champion's design in ARAM? She could be tweaked stat-wise to ensure she isn't as oppressive in that game-mode but you shouldn't be discussing whether a champion needs reworking or not based on their performance in a game-mode which is unrelated to the core game.
